Pengedar Jaringan LP Salemba Ditangkap di Tambora, Sabu Rp 2,59 M Disita
06 Nov 2019, 13:02 by Samsudhuha Wildansyah, Jabbar Ramdhani
Jakarta - Polsek Tambora melakukan pengembangan kasus peredaran narkoba setelah menggelar operasi premanisme. Seorang pria pengedar narkoba ditangkap dengan barang bukti sabu seberat 1,85 kg atau senilai Rp 2,59 miliar.
"Tim mengamankan orang tersebut bernama Nurman (45) dan melakukan penggeledahan badan serta kendaraan sepeda motor, hasilnya ditemukan tiga paket klip besar di dalam kotak boks sepeda motor tersangka," kata Kapolsek Tambora Kompol Iver Son Manossoh kepada wartawan, Rabu (6/11/2019).
Nurman ditangkap di Jl Raya Utan Panjang RT 06/05 Utan Panjang, Kemayoran, Jakarta Pusat, pada Selasa (5/11). Setelah diinterogasi, Nurman mengaku masih menyimpan tiga paket sabu di rumahnya dan 12 paket sabu di apartemen Greenlake Sunter, Jakpus.
Tim yang dipimpin Panit Narkoba Polsek Tambora Iptu Yugo Pambudi pun menemukan 15 paket sabu di dua lokasi tersebut. Kepada polisi Nurman mengaku sabu tersebut peredarannya dikendalikan seseorang berinisial FR yang sedang menjalani hukuman di LP Salemba.


Barang bukti sabu ini disebut dimiliki dan diatur peredarannya oleh napi LP Salemba (Dok. Istimewa)

"Kami akan terus dalami keterlibatan FR dalam pengendalian jaringan peredaran narkoba," ujar dia.
Iver mengatakan sabu tersebut jika dirupiahkan mencapai Rp 2,59 miliar. Nurman dijerat Pasal 114 UU RI Nomor 35 Tahun 2009 tentang Narkotika.
Sebelumnya, Polsek Tambora menggelar Operasi Premanisme pada Selasa (5/11) siang. Polisi mengamankan 14 orang preman hingga narkoba. Sementara barang bukti yang disita berupa puluhan botol minuman keras hingga enam plastik kecil sabu dan alat isap (bong).
Polisi juga mengetes urine 14 pelaku yang diamankan. Hasilnya, sembilan orang positif benzo dan dua orang positif metamfetamin atau sabu.

(jbr/mei)

Salemba LP Network Dealer Arrested in Tambora, Sabu Rp. 2.59 Billion Confiscated
Nov 6 2019, 13:02 by Samsudhuha Wildansyah, Jabbar Ramdhani
Jakarta - Tambora Police Station is developing a drug trafficking case after holding a thuggery operation. A drug dealer is arrested with evidence of methamphetamine weighing 1.85 kg or worth Rp 2.59 billion.
"The team secured the person named Nurman (45) and conducted a body search and motorbike vehicle, the results were found three large clip packages inside the box of the suspect's motorcycle box," Tambora Police Chief Iver Son Manossoh told reporters on Wednesday (6/11 / 2019).
Nurman was arrested on Jl Raya Utan Panjang RT 06/05 Utan Panjang, Kemayoran, Central Jakarta, on Tuesday (5/11). After being interrogated, Nurman admitted that he still kept three packages of methamphetamine at his home and 12 packages of methamphetamine in the Greenlake Sunter apartment in Central Jakarta.
The team led by the Narcotics Committee of Tambora Iptu Police Yugo Pambudi also found 15 packages of methamphetamine at the two locations. Nurman admitted to the police that methamphetamine was controlled by someone with the initials FR who was serving his sentence at LP Salemba.


This evidence of methamphetamine is said to be owned and regulated by prisoner LP Salemba (Special Doc.)

"We will continue to explore the involvement of the FR in controlling the drug distribution network," he said.
Iver said that methamphetamine when reached Rp 2.59 billion. Nurman was charged with Article 114 of RI Law Number 35 Year 2009 concerning Narcotics.
Previously, Tambora Police Station held Operation Thuggery on Tuesday (11/5) afternoon. The police secured 14 thugs to drugs. While the evidence seized in the form of dozens of bottles of liquor up to six small plastic methamphetamine and suction (bong).
The police also tested the urine of 14 perpetrators who were secured. The result, nine people were positive for benzo and two people were positive for methamphetamine or methamphetamine.
